verses.kjv: And he arose from thence, and cometh into the coasts of Judaea by the farther side of Jordan: and the people resort unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.
verses.web: He arose from there and came into the borders of Judea and beyond the Jordan. Multitudes came together to him again. As he usually did, he was again teaching them.
verses.ct: Jesus left that area and traveled to the region of Judea and across the Jordan River. Once again crowds gathered around him, and as he always did, he began teaching them.

verses.kjv: And the Pharisees came to him, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife? tempting him.
verses.web: Pharisees came to him testing him, and asked him, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?”
verses.ct: Some Pharisees approached him with a question designed to trap him. "Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?" they asked.

verses.kjv: And he answered and said unto them, What did Moses command you?
verses.web: He answered, “What did Moses command you?”
verses.ct: He replied, "What did Moses command you?"

verses.kjv: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put her away.
verses.web: They said, “Moses allowed a certificate of divorce to be written, and to divorce her.”
verses.ct: They said, "Moses allowed a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto them, For the hardness of your heart he wrote you this precept.
verses.web: But Jesus said to them, “For your hardness of heart, he wrote you this commandment.
verses.ct: Jesus told them, "Moses wrote that rule for you because your hearts are hard.

verses.kjv: But from the beginning of the creation God made them male and female.
verses.web: But from the beginning of the creation, God made them male and female.
verses.ct: But from the very beginning of creation, God made them male and female.

verses.kjv: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and cleave to his wife;
verses.web: For this cause a man will leave his father and mother, and will join to his wife,
verses.ct: That's why a man will leave his father and mother and be united with his wife,

verses.kjv: And they twain shall be one flesh: so then they are no more twain, but one flesh.
verses.web: and the two will become one flesh, so that they are no longer two, but one flesh.
verses.ct: and the two will become one flesh. They are no longer two separate people — they are one.

verses.kjv: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.
verses.web: What therefore God has joined together, let no man separate.”
verses.ct: So what God has joined together, no one should separate."

verses.kjv: And in the house his disciples asked him again of the same matter.
verses.web: In the house, his disciples asked him again about the same matter.
verses.ct: Later, when they were back inside the house, his disciples brought up the same topic again.

verses.kjv: And he saith unto them, Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her.
verses.web: He said to them, “Whoever divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery against her.
verses.ct: He told them, "Any man who divorces his wife and marries someone else commits adultery against her.

verses.kjv: And if a woman shall put away her husband, and be married to another, she committeth adultery.
verses.web: If a woman herself divorces her husband, and marries another, she commits adultery.”
verses.ct: And if a woman divorces her husband and marries someone else, she commits adultery."

verses.kjv: And they brought young children to him, that he should touch them: and his disciples rebuked those that brought them.
verses.web: They were bringing to him little children, that he should touch them, but the disciples rebuked those who were bringing them.
verses.ct: People were bringing their little children to Jesus so he could touch and bless them, but the disciples scolded them for it.

verses.kjv: But when Jesus saw it, he was much displeased, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of God.
verses.web: But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation, and said to them, “Allow the little children to come to me! Don’t forbid them, for God’s Kingdom belongs to such as these.
verses.ct: When Jesus saw this, he was deeply upset. "Let the little children come to me!" he said. "Don't stop them, because the kingdom of God belongs to people like these.

verses.kjv: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall not enter therein.
verses.web: Most certainly I tell you, whoever will not receive God’s Kingdom like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”
verses.ct: I tell you the truth: anyone who doesn't receive the kingdom of God the way a little child does will never enter it."

verses.kjv: And he took them up in his arms, put his hands upon them, and blessed them.
verses.web: He took them in his arms, and blessed them, laying his hands on them.
verses.ct: Then he gathered the children into his arms, placed his hands on them, and blessed them.

verses.kjv: And when he was gone forth into the way, there came one running, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Master, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?
verses.web: As he was going out into the way, one ran to him, knelt before him, and asked him, “Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?”
verses.ct: As Jesus was heading out on the road, a man came running up and dropped to his knees before him. "Good Teacher," he asked, "what must I do to inherit eternal life?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? there is none good but one, that is, God.
verses.web: Jesus said to him, “Why do you call me good? No one is good except one—God.
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "Why do you call me good? No one is good except God alone.

verses.kjv: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not kill, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Defraud not, Honour thy father and mother.
verses.web: You know the commandments: ‘Do not murder,’ ‘Do not commit adultery,’ ‘Do not steal,’ ‘Do not give false testimony,’ ‘Do not defraud,’ ‘Honor your father and mother.’ ”
verses.ct: You know the commandments: 'Do not murder,' 'Do not commit adultery,' 'Do not steal,' 'Do not give false testimony,' 'Do not defraud,' 'Honor your father and mother.'"

verses.kjv: And he answered and said unto him, Master, all these have I observed from my youth.
verses.web: He said to him, “Teacher, I have observed all these things from my youth.”
verses.ct: "Teacher," the man replied, "I've kept all of these since I was young."

verses.kjv: Then Jesus beholding him loved him, and said unto him, One thing thou lackest: go thy way, sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, take up the cross, and follow me.
verses.web: Jesus looking at him loved him, and said to him, “One thing you lack. Go, sell whatever you have, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me, taking up the cross.”
verses.ct: Jesus looked at him and loved him. "There's one thing you're missing," he said. "Go sell everything you own and give the money to the poor. You'll have treasure in heaven. Then come, take up the cross, and follow me."

verses.kjv: And he was sad at that saying, and went away grieved: for he had great possessions.
verses.web: But his face fell at that saying, and he went away sorrowful, for he was one who had great possessions.
verses.ct: The man's face fell when he heard this, and he walked away heartbroken — because he was very wealthy.

verses.kjv: And Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.web: Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples, “How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!”
verses.ct: Jesus looked around at his disciples and said, "How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!"

verses.kjv: And the disciples were astonished at his words. But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them, Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!
verses.web: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answered again, “Children, how hard it is for those who trust in riches to enter into God’s Kingdom!
verses.ct: The disciples were stunned by his words. But Jesus said again, "Children, how hard it is for those who trust in riches to enter the kingdom of God!

verses.kjv: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.web: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye than for a rich man to enter into God’s Kingdom.”
verses.ct: It's easier for a camel to pass through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God."

verses.kjv: And they were astonished out of measure, saying among themselves, Who then can be saved?
verses.web: They were exceedingly astonished, saying to him, “Then who can be saved?”
verses.ct: They were completely astonished and said to each other, "Then who can possibly be saved?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus looking upon them saith, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.
verses.web: Jesus, looking at them, said, “With men it is impossible, but not with God, for all things are possible with God.”
verses.ct: Jesus looked at them and said, "For people, it's impossible. But not for God — because all things are possible with God."

verses.kjv: Then Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.
verses.web: Peter began to tell him, “Behold, we have left all, and have followed you.”
verses.ct: Peter spoke up: "We've left everything behind to follow you."

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel’s,
verses.web: Jesus said, “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or land, for my sake, and for the sake of the Good News,
verses.ct: Jesus said, "I tell you the truth: no one who has left home, brothers, sisters, father, mother, wife, children, or land for my sake and for the sake of the gospel

verses.kjv: But he shall receive an hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions; and in the world to come eternal life.
verses.web: but he will receive one hundred times more now in this time: houses, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, with persecutions; and in the age to come eternal life.
verses.ct: will fail to receive 100 times as much in this present life — homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children, and land, along with persecutions — and in the age to come, eternal life.

verses.kjv: But many that are first shall be last; and the last first.
verses.web: But many who are first will be last; and the last first.”
verses.ct: But many who are first will be last, and the last will be first."

verses.kjv: And they were in the way going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus went before them: and they were amazed; and as they followed, they were afraid. And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them what things should happen unto him,
verses.web: They were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going in front of them, and they were amazed; and those who followed were afraid. He again took the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were going to happen to him.
verses.ct: They were on the road heading up to Jerusalem, with Jesus walking ahead of them. The disciples were amazed, and those following behind were afraid. He pulled the 12 aside again and began telling them what was about to happen to him.

verses.kjv: Saying, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests, and unto the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him to the Gentiles:
verses.web: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be delivered to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death, and will deliver him to the Gentiles.
verses.ct: "Listen," he said, "we're going up to Jerusalem. The Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and the scribes. They will condemn him to death and turn him over to the Gentiles.

verses.kjv: And they shall mock him, and shall scourge him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him: and the third day he shall rise again.
verses.web: They will mock him, spit on him, scourge him, and kill him. On the third day he will rise again.”
verses.ct: They will mock him, spit on him, flog him, and kill him. But on the 3rd day, he will rise again."

verses.kjv: And James and John, the sons of Zebedee, come unto him, saying, Master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall desire.
verses.web: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came near to him, saying, “Teacher, we want you to do for us whatever we will ask.”
verses.ct: James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to Jesus and said, "Teacher, we want you to do something for us — whatever we ask."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What would ye that I should do for you?
verses.web: He said to them, “What do you want me to do for you?”
verses.ct: "What do you want me to do for you?" he asked.

verses.kjv: They said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and the other on thy left hand, in thy glory.
verses.web: They said to him, “Grant to us that we may sit, one at your right hand, and one at your left hand, in your glory.”
verses.ct: They answered, "When you come into your glory, let one of us sit at your right hand and the other at your left."

verses.kjv: But Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask: can ye drink of the cup that I drink of? and be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?
verses.web: But Jesus said to them, “You don’t know what you are asking. Are you able to drink the cup that I drink, and to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?”
verses.ct: Jesus said to them, "You don't know what you're asking. Can you drink the cup that I'm about to drink? Can you be baptized with the baptism I'm about to endure?"

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, We can. And Jesus said unto them, Ye shall indeed drink of the cup that I drink of; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:
verses.web: They said to him, “We are able.” Jesus said to them, “You shall indeed drink the cup that I drink, and you shall be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with;
verses.ct: "We can," they said. Jesus told them, "You will indeed drink the cup I drink, and you will be baptized with the baptism I endure.

verses.kjv: But to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared.
verses.web: but to sit at my right hand and at my left hand is not mine to give, but for whom it has been prepared.”
verses.ct: But sitting at my right or left — that's not mine to give. Those places belong to the ones they've been prepared for."

verses.kjv: And when the ten heard it, they began to be much displeased with James and John.
verses.web: When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant toward James and John.
verses.ct: When the other 10 disciples heard about this, they were furious with James and John.

verses.kjv: But Jesus called them to him, and saith unto them, Ye know that they which are accounted to rule over the Gentiles exercise lordship over them; and their great ones exercise authority upon them.
verses.web: Jesus summoned them, and said to them, “You know that they who are recognized as rulers over the nations lord it over them, and their great ones exercise authority over them.
verses.ct: Jesus called them all together and said, "You know how it works in the world — rulers lord their power over people, and officials throw their authority around.

verses.kjv: But so shall it not be among you: but whosoever will be great among you, shall be your minister:
verses.web: But it shall not be so among you, but whoever wants to become great among you shall be your servant.
verses.ct: But it must not be that way among you. Whoever wants to be great among you must be your servant.

verses.kjv: And whosoever of you will be the chiefest, shall be servant of all.
verses.web: Whoever of you wants to become first among you, shall be bondservant of all.
verses.ct: And whoever wants to be first must be the slave of everyone.

verses.kjv: For even the Son of man came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
verses.web: For the Son of Man also came not to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.”
verses.ct: Even the Son of Man didn't come to be served, but to serve — and to give his life as a ransom for many."

verses.kjv: And they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, sat by the highway side begging.
verses.web: They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.
verses.ct: They arrived in Jericho. As Jesus was leaving the city with his disciples and a large crowd, a blind beggar named Bartimaeus, the son of Timaeus, was sitting beside the road.

verses.kjv: And when he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.
verses.web: When he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and say, “Jesus, you son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.ct: When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth passing by, he started shouting, "Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!"

verses.kjv: And many charged him that he should hold his peace: but he cried the more a great deal, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.
verses.web: Many rebuked him, that he should be quiet, but he cried out much more, “You son of David, have mercy on me!”
verses.ct: Many people told him to be quiet, but he only shouted louder, "Son of David, have mercy on me!"

verses.kjv: And Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be called. And they call the blind man, saying unto him, Be of good comfort, rise; he calleth thee.
verses.web: Jesus stood still, and said, “Call him.” They called the blind man, saying to him, “Cheer up! Get up. He is calling you!”
verses.ct: Jesus stopped and said, "Call him over." So they called to the blind man, "Cheer up! Get on your feet — he's calling for you!"

verses.kjv: And he, casting away his garment, rose, and came to Jesus.
verses.web: He, casting away his cloak, sprang up, and came to Jesus.
verses.ct: Bartimaeus threw off his cloak, jumped to his feet, and came to Jesus.

verses.kjv: And Jesus answered and said unto him, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? The blind man said unto him, Lord, that I might receive my sight.
verses.web: Jesus asked him, “What do you want me to do for you?” The blind man said to him, “Rabboni, that I may see again.”
verses.ct: "What do you want me to do for you?" Jesus asked him. The blind man said, "Lord, I want to see again."

verses.kjv: And Jesus said unto him, Go thy way; thy faith hath made thee whole. And immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.
verses.web: Jesus said to him, “Go your way. Your faith has made you well.” Immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus on the way.
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "Go — your faith has made you well." Instantly his sight was restored, and he followed Jesus down the road.
